text:
Garden Of The Gods / Keahiakawelo

5 stars from 8 reviews
Address Polihua Rd, Lanai City, HI 96763
A long, bumpy, 4x4-only trail is the only way to get here. Spectacular view all around once you do arrive.

• General: Cost: Free • General: Photo Opportunity
• Hiking: Hiking • Hiking: Nature Walk
• Sightseeing: Great Views • Cultural & Historical: Heiau / Sacred Site

Matt Anderson's Take
Keahiakawelo, according to Hawaiian lore, is the result of a contest between two kahuna (priests) from Lana'i and Moloka'i. Each was challenged to keep a fire burning on their respective island longer than the other, and the winner's island would be rewarded with great abundance. The Lanai kahuna, Kawelo, used every piece of vegetation in Keahiakawelo to keep his fire burning, which is why this area is so barren today.

So that's the history of Keahiakawelo. But let's talk more about the present day reality of what the Garden of the Gods (as it's more commonly called today) actually is. It's a Mars-like landscape filled with all sort of rocks and boulders out in the middle of nowhere.

Seriously, that's what it actually is: a rock garden. If you were expecting some sort of lush garden you will be disappointed but that doesn't mean you should pass this up.

It's about 14 miles if you are driving from the Four Seasons Resort Lanai at Manele Bay and about 7 miles from the main town area and no matter how you go it's about 6 miles of pure off road trail driving. We're talking dusty, dirty, bumpy, 4x4 only offroading goodness (even if you can only do 5-10 miles per hour the whole time).

So while the rocks aren't really a destination in my opinion, the real treat is the scenic view you get once you make the trip. Because it's an amazing view all around, including great views of Moloka'i island. So bring a camera but also pack in some snacks and plenty of drinks because you will be out in the middle of nowhere and likely won't have a cell single in some parts.

Pack extra supplies to be safe, and consider bringing toilet paper too because there are no facilities of any kind out here (and also a plastic bag to pack out what you packed in). That's right, hiking rules are in play so also ready up on Hiking Safety & Essentials just to be, well, safe.

This is a neat place to see and if you are on Lana'i and have a rental car (4x4 only) it's worth the trip but don't expect anything beyond scenery because you won't find it here.

A pretty amazing place to see and the journey is part of the adventure. Go slow and take it easy and enjoy the trip there and back. Sure, it's just a rock garden but it's probably the most spectacular rock garden you'll ever see.
Brett D
Joined: Mar 2017
Reviews: 56
Likes Received: 1
While vacationing here we decided to rent a 4x4 and check out the Garden of the Gods. Didn't think to much about it as it looked like it was going to be nothing but just a lot of rocks, but once we go there I was awestruck, the rocks were fantastic. I took so many pictures of the scenery and loved the feeling of being in a place of isolation almost like we were the only ones left on earth. It can be a little rough of a ride but well worth it.
Kim S
Joined: Oct 2016
Reviews: 10
Likes Received: 0
I guess I can't review Lanai as a whole so I will review via 1/2 day trip from Maui via Trilogy Excursions. This was not a cheap trip by any means. $500 for 3 people but it was a worthwhile experience. The Trilogy ferry trip was 50 minutes each way. No commentary or conversation from the crew; simply transport. It was a relatively smooth trip, though my son did get a little seasick. I chose to ride outside, where I can see the scenery to keep my mind occupied and less inclined to notice the waves.

We chose the 1/2 day Trekker excursion. This is the ferry to the island, where you are met by a guide in a 4x4 and taken to various sites around the island. Depending on how many people are in your group, the sites may vary. My son was very interested in the history of the island and what will happen to it now that it has been nearly bought out by the CEO of Oracle.

Our guide was a native Lanaian who went by Uncle Tommy. We got a little more history than requested as he showed us his old home and an area called "Snob Hill" which took time into our other stops. We didn't really get to see much of Shipwreck Beach because of the delays but it was interesting nonetheless.

Garden of the Gods was awesome and worth the trip in itself. We had to laugh at all the tourists who thought they would save a buck by renting their own 4x4 and do the tour themselves. Most of them were up to their axles in red sand and needed to be pulled out. So much for saving a little. Another stop was the new Four Seasons Hotel, which is a big part of the Island's new ownership and is actually a good thing for it's people. Honestly, Garden of the Gods was so awesome that if I return, I may try renting my own 4x4 so I can spend a little time hiking there. From what the tour guide told us, whenever a scene in Hawaii Five-0 requires a remote setting, the crew often heads to Lanai. With the exception of the massive hotels, it is an island more or less lost in time.
Sue K
Joined: Mar 2016
Reviews: 196
Likes Received: 9
I loved The Garden of the Gods! We hired a jeep and hit the red dirt track leading us to this amazing spot. The stunning, desolate landscape is wild and windswept. You can see Maui on the horizon. The boulders and rock formations are cool and the colors unbelievable. We had the place to ourselves, which made it even more special. Definitely worth the bumpy journey.
Teresa a
Joined: Jul 2016
Reviews: 10
Likes Received: 0
Look for the stables and then get on the dirt track to Garden of the Gods. It's a fun, bumpy drive there and we had the whole place to ourselves. With views of Maui, the rocks of all shapes and sizes formed the landscape. It had the feel of being on the moon with the exception of the blue skies. Fabulous.
Dawn G
Joined: Mar 2016
Reviews: 26
Likes Received: 0
If you are on Lanai this is something you really should take the time to do. It's a quick drive through sort of thing once you're there. It does feel other-worldly and is a cool backdrop for photographs. As others have mentioned it's a bit of a long drive on a two-track road but getting there is half the fun.
Dewei T
Joined: Aug 2015
Reviews: 20
Likes Received: 0
It's basically the closest I'll ever get to Mars! What a neat place to see. Very windy out here and no bathrooms for a long, long way. See what I'm getting at here? Mind the direction of the wind if you have to empty your bladder out here! The ride here is pretty long and bumpy but also tons of fun. Gas up and bring food and water for sure.
Joined: Apr 2015
Reviews: 21
Likes Received: 1
One of the most amazing places to see in my opinion. It's like entering another world. The views here are just incredible in every direction. It's a bumpy trail getting here so rent a Jeep, put it into 4 wheel drive, and blaze a trail.

Location, staff

Grăbiţi-vă - disponibilitate redusă!

Dawn ONeill
The property was beautiful with stunning views. The property house manager Mark was so nice and so attentive along with Lisa at the front desk. The description for The property needs to be updated. The appliances refrigerator and washer and dryer where extra small vs how they were Described. The beach was so beautiful in front of The property and the plunge pool was out favorite thing about the villa. The only thing that was not 100% was our housekeeper was not very nice. In fact she was very rude and in return ask For her not to come back after her first time in the villa. The manager from Blue Sky put a lot Of pressure on us and said we had to have her back once before we left bc of The laws on the island. I.T was not something we really wanted to deal With while on vacation at all. Also the original description. Of the villa wasn’t straight forward saying I.T was among other villas, we thought I.T was it’s own property.

Bruny Island Long Weekend    April 2019

Wonderful 2 nights/3 days hiking on Bruny.


Incredibly we were there on a weekend with record high temperatures (38 degrees !!) so our hikes included plenty of beach swims in pristine bays. Our guides were super human. brilliant chefs and a wealth of local knowledge shared at every opportunity.

Our campsite was beyond gorgeous, comfy beds with doonas and private balconies. The bush shower was a highlight an experience I will never forget.

Highly recommended.

Very Enjoyable Stay

3,2 sur juillet 24, 2016

When we travel we stay at B& Bs as much as possible. The Bundling Board Inn meet our expectations. The room was clean and the facilities met our expectations. The inn Keepers were very easy to deal with and our breakfast meet our expectations. The town of Woodstock, Il was quite interesting and we enjoyed the time we were downtown.

R. Baker

3,4 sur juillet 13, 2016

Our stay was quite enjoyable. The owners were very helpful and we enjoyed out time at breakfast with them and the other guest. Woodstock Il is a very quaint and enjoyable town.

Weekend stay

Great stay! More than I expected. Great place to stay !

Bundling Board and Awesome B & B!

5 sur mai 07, 2016

From the moment we walked in we were treated like royalty by Merida and Russell! The care, the food, and great conversation all made us feel like family or old friends. Merida and Russell make incredible breakfasts, cookies and took into account all our food allergies. The room was homey, beautifully decorated, and tremendously comfortable! Charming B&B, first class stay!

5 sur février 10, 2016

Stayed at Bundling Board Inn the night before Groundhog Day in Woodstock, IL (where the movie was filmed). Beautiful property and room, and the breakfast the next morning was truly one to remember. I highly recommend this B&B, and we will be coming back again!

Great Stay

4,6 sur février 04, 2016

Walking into the Bundling Board Inn was like walking into the Victorian past, with beautiful furniture and antiques. The hosts, Merida and Russell Johns made us feel right at home, especially with their homemade cookies hot out of the oven. They are very knowledgeable about the history of the house and community. The breakfasts were awesome and Russell makes great smoothies. We highly recommend this B&B.

Wonderful Experience

5 sur août 31, 2015

We travel the country and stay at B & B' s when ever possible. Would highly recommend Bundling Board. Able to provide vegan options for breakfast and snacks. Owners are delightful. Jack & Margaret Gariota

Wonderfully enjoyable

5 sur février 19, 2015

We had a wonderful time at the Bundling Board. The owners are engaging without being intrusive and provide both a beautiful place and a terrific breakfast. We'll be back.

Great weekend getaway!

5 sur février 04, 2015

Recently spent a wonderful weekend at this great B & B! The owners provided an outstanding experience that included turndown service before bed. The bed was super comfy! They went out of their way to provide anything we needed. Quaint town with a wonderful town square within a few blocks. Thanks for a lovely stay!

Perfect Place, Perfect Location, Perfect Innkeepers!!!

5 sur septembre 03, 2014

My stay was comfortable and easy. The breakfast was Big, and oh so good! The main town was a very short walk, great location. Merida and Russell make you feel right at home. Would highly recommend this place to anyone!!!


5 sur août 18, 2014

This is a charming B&B in a charming town! Easy to walk to the town square for dinner. Breakfast was fantastic and the conversation so interesting. The room was delightfully full of lovely antiques and had a warm feeling--perfect for relaxing! We would highly recommend!! Dan & Donna, Wisconsin

Great first time at a B&B

5 sur août 12, 2014

This was a first time for me and my wife at a B&B. We had a great time and it exceeded our expectations.

Our little getaway

5 sur juillet 23, 2014

We had a lovely two-night stay while traveling to and from a nearby town for a family wedding. Breakfasts were plentiful and very tasty, with attention to our gluten-free diet. Fresh-baked cookies and tea were waiting for us each night. The room was very clean, tastefully decorated and the bed very comfortable. Our hosts were just the best!

A Perfect Weekend Getaway

5 sur juillet 09, 2014

Merida and Russell were perfect hosts, and they made our brief time in Woodstock totally enjoyable. The breakfasts were outstanding, and dining in town was top-notch. We had a great time at the fireworks in town, and the Inn's location was convenient for our visit to the Illinois Railway Museum. Touring the Farmers' Market on Saturday was an unplanned bonus.

Our Stay Was Fabulous

4,6 sur avril 29, 2014

Rida and Russell (the B&B owners) could not have been more gracious and welcoming. They made us comfortable instantly upon arrival and were lovely hosts. Our stay was delightful and we heartily recommend the Bundling Board Inn.

Wonderful B&B. Highly Recommend!

5 sur avril 29, 2014

My new wife and I had an absolute wonderful time staying at the Bundling Board Inn. The rooms are so comfy and warm. Every detail is spot on and we both felt like we were home (but without the noise and distraction!). Merida and Russell are so very nice and just perfect hosts. The breakfast that they prepared was amazing despite my wife and I distracting them with polite conversation. I can't recommend them enough and hope to stay there again soon!

Wonderful First Time B&B Experience

5 sur novembre 16, 2013

Merida and Russell are warm and welcoming. The B&B is beautiful and cozy. Our breakfast was deliciously AMAZING!!! Overall, a fabulous experience - we HIGHLY recommend the Bundling Board Inn

Awesome place

Enjoyed stay. Merida,Russell, and Bruno very nice ,clean and friendly Breakfast was great. Will stay again when returning to woodstock. Phil and chris

Fantastic getaway

5 sur octobre 20, 2013

My girlfriend and I really enjoyed the accommodations at the Inn as well as the town of Woodstock itself. It's a great getaway for anyone, even if you're just looking to escape the Chicagoland area.

Wonderful stay!

5 sur octobre 17, 2013

Merida and Russell are wonderful hosts. After greeting us, they showed us around the house, telling the history and why the names of the rooms. They pointed out a refrigerator in the kitchen for drinks for guests and said there would be brownies and hot tea for us that evening. The room was spacious and cozy, beautiful bedding and nice plump towels. The breakfast was outstanding, the best we have had anywhere! There were even seconds if you could find the room! We will definitely be back.

We totally loved our hosts!

5 sur octobre 11, 2013

Attention to detail is the name of the game. If you enjoy seeing interesting old collectibles, then this is the place for you!

September 2013

5 sur septembre 22, 2013

The rooms are lovely, the price is fair, breakfast was great. A very homey experience. Our hosts were very friendly and gracious and we were just 4 blocks from the square. No complaints and no suggestions for improvement. Everything was just swell.

Woodstock Outing

4,4 sur septembre 13, 2013

Comfortable room with excellent food and service. Will definitely come back again!

Anniversay getaway

4,2 sur août 28, 2013

We had never been to a B & B until our recent stay at the Bundling Board Inn. They have quaint rooms. The breakfast was phenominal. The only down side to our stay was that the room we chose was in the front of the house. The B & B is on a busy street and I am a light sleeper.

Excellent lodging and conversation

5 sur août 02, 2013

Lovely breakfast and good conversation with the owners.


5 sur juillet 09, 2013

Merida and Russell's B&B is just the greatest and so are they! Our stay with them was just wonderful.

“Metra Vacation!! Beautiful inn and wonderful hosts!”

5 sur juin 16, 2013

My wife and I stayed at the Bundling Board Inn back in November for a quick weekend away from Chicago to de-stress and we could not have been more pleased with the results. Merida and Russell were the perfect hosts and their home is quiet, comfortable, and charming. I've stayed in B & B's that are cloying, overstuffed, and overdone, but the Bundling Board is definitely not one of those. It is much more like the country home of a relative, not too precious, just comfortably familiar. Breakfast was hearty and delicious, and Merida kept us supplied with brownies and cookies baked especially for my wife's gluten-free diet. Woodstock is a great small town, with a number of good restaurants. I also treated my wife to a massage at nearby Harmony Falls and she found it to be superior to a lot of the pricier Chicago places. Therapeutic, relaxing, no-nonsense. I can't recommend the Bundling Board and the town of Woodstock enough. Treat yourself to some peace and quiet outside of the city.


4,6 sur décembre 13, 2012

This was our first time at a B&B. It was a great experience. Our hosts were wonderful, the room was very nice and the breakfast was outstanding.

Wonderful friends and beautiful memories.

5 sur novembre 21, 2012

On our 33rd wedding anniversary we decided to stay at the Bundling Board Inn. it is a beautiful Victorian house ,with wonderful innkeepers, Merida and Russell.As we entered the house we could smell the aroma of homemade chocolate chip cookies,they were very good.We stayed in the Mildred room it was beautiful room.We walked into town,it was less than 10 minutes away!We ate at the Public House the food was very good as was the service.The breakfast at the inn the next morning was fabulous !! Merida and Russell are wonderful people they made us feel like part of the family. Thank you ,Victoria and Timothy
